title: A mistake in the Greek translation In the webpage "Reverse Image Search"
content:
Hello,

A mistake in the Greek translation
In the webpage "Reverse Image Search",

"Visually Similar images" at the bottom of the page
Is translated in Greek as
"Οπτικά πανομοιότυπες εικόνες"

Which literally means
"Visually Identical images"
and is obviously wrong.

The correct translation is
"Οπτικά παρόμοιες εικόνες" or just plain
"Παρόμοιες εικόνες"
"Similar images"

I have reported this from the Chrome app,
as well as two other bugs, long ago.


Pinch to zoom doesn't respond immediately, or at all, on some sites like
Crowdin (a translation site), and others

And also
Chrome settings > Accessibility > Text size 160%

The letters in Crowdin are not all the same.
https://crowdin.com/translate/foldersync/10726/en-el#5467726

Some are too small and others are the right size

These things worked perfectly before.
The problems begun only with the new Chrome updates.

Not only they never fixed this,
but they never bothered to reply.

I post it here, because I don't know what else to do.

There are also some mistakes in the Greek translation in the YouTube app,
but I don't think that they really care.


Thanks
